title: Mets All-Star Pitcher R.A. Dickey to Inspire Kids From United Neighborhood Houses
summary: New York - Citi will hold its third Citi Field Kids program for the 2012 season, and the first outside the confines of Citi Field, August 8 at 11 a.m. at the Jacob A. Riis Neighborhood Settlement House in Long Island City, N.Y. The event will feature New York Mets All-Star pitcher R.A. Dickey, renowned knuckleballer and author, addressing kids from United Neighborhood Houses. SNY anchor and reporter Michelle Yu will once again serve as master of ceremonies.
tag-1: Mets All-Star Pitcher R.A. Dickey to Inspire Kids From United Neighborhood Houses
tag-3: New York – Citi will hold its third Citi Field Kids program for the 2012 season, and the first outside the confines of Citi Field, August 8 at 11 a.m. at the Jacob A. Riis Neighborhood Settlement House in Long Island City, N.Y. The event will feature New York Mets All-Star pitcher R.A. Dickey, renowned knuckleballer and author, addressing kids from United Neighborhood Houses. SNY anchor and reporter Michelle Yu will once again serve as master of ceremonies.
tag-4: Additionally, members of the Stony Brook University Seawolves baseball team, who earlier this summer became the first-ever team from the America East Conference to advance to the College World Series, will conduct a clinic at Queensbridge Park with the kids immediately following the formal Citi Field Kids program.
tag-5: Now in its fourth season, Citi Field Kids is an educational and motivational community-based initiative for New York City middle- and high-school students developed by Citi in collaboration with the Jackie Robinson Foundation, the Mets and United Neighborhood Houses. Citi Field Kids was launched on April 15, 2009, in conjunction with Major League Baseball's annual Jackie Robinson Day.
tag-6: The series of in-season events has sought to positively impact students through the nine values and ideals of Jackie Robinson, the legendary pioneer and great American trailblazer who broke baseball's color barrier with the Brooklyn Dodgers in 1947. The nine values he embodied – courage, integrity, determination, persistence, citizenship, justice, commitment, teamwork and excellence – serve as a focal point of the Jackie Robinson Rotunda at Citi Field to advance and perpetuate Robinson's humanitarian ideals.
tag-7: In addition to Dickey and the Stony Brook clinic, the program on Wednesday will include a presentation from a Jackie Robinson Foundation Scholarship alumnus.
tag-8: The kids participating in this Citi Field Kids program will receive tickets to a Mets game where they will have the opportunity to tour the Jackie Robinson Rotunda at Citi Field and learn even more about Robinson's legacy and impact.
tag-9: "Citi is proud to offer programs such as Citi Field Kids to help make a positive impact today on the leaders of tomorrow," said Eileen Auld, Tri-State Regional Director of Citi Community Development. "We are pleased to partner with the Mets on this important initiative and are delighted that R.A., who has fought adversity his whole career and life, will be able to share his story with these children. We are also delighted to have members of the inspirational Stony Brook baseball team on hand to show the youngsters the finer points of the game. We would also like to thank Modell's Sporting Goods for their generous donation of baseballs for the clinic. Citi Field Kids shows that when organizations like this all come together, our communities are the real winners."
tag-10: Dave Howard, Executive Vice President, Business Operations, New York Mets, said, "The Citi Field Kids program is one of many community initiatives that are vital and integral to our partnership with Citi. We are honored to be part of this important program and help have a profound effect on the lives of these kids."
tag-11: UNH is comprised of 38 nonprofit organizations that make up the federation of settlement houses and community centers. For over 90 years, UNH and its nonprofit members have been improving the lives of New Yorkers in the five boroughs by providing social, educational, and recreational services for people of all ages. UNH works specifically with youth across New York City to advocate for important programs such as the Summer Youth Employment Program, while the 38 nonprofit members provide programs such as afterschool and summer camp, arts workshops and education, leadership training and recreation of all types – all designed to support them in becoming successful adults.
tag-12: "The Citi Field Kids program is a wonderful opportunity for young people involved with member agencies of United Neighborhood Houses to learn about Jackie Robinson's journey from the Jackie Robinson Foundation Scholars, as well as hear from a very inspirational Major Leaguer," said Nancy Wackstein, Executive Director, United Neighborhood Houses of New York. "Our kids are tomorrow's leaders, and it is wonderful that the Mets and Citi are investing in their futures as part of a solid commitment to New York City."
tag-13: Each participant in the Citi Field Kids program will receive a complimentary gift bag and lunch.
